sense.name: Preserve in a tin or jar.
sense.examples: My mother cans tomatoes in the summer for use during the winter. I like to can things.

sense.name: Terminate the employment of; discharge from an office or position.
sense.examples: The boss canned his secretary today. The company canned 25% of its workers. I'd love to can that guy if I could.

sense.name: CAN IT: stop speaking, usually in the imperative.
sense.examples: Can it, Louise! He finally canned it after his mother started spanking him.

sense.name: Discard (something).
sense.examples: He finally canned the idea and moved on to something easier. We need to can the notion as a culture that we're dominant as a world power. I suggest we can this whole line of research.
